metadata.Title: CVE-2020-8184 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A reliance on cookies without validation/integrity check security vulnerability exists in rack < 2.2.3, rack < 2.1.4 that makes it is possible for an attacker to forge a secure or host-only cookie prefix.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-8184` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

librack-ruby - 1.5.2-3+deb8u3ubuntu1~esm4
librack-ruby1.8 - 1.5.2-3+deb8u3ubuntu1~esm4
librack-ruby1.9.1 - 1.5.2-3+deb8u3ubuntu1~esm4
ruby-rack - 1.5.2-3+deb8u3ubuntu1~esm4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ruby-rack package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.5.2-3+deb8u3ubuntu1~esm4').
